meanings.definition: A person who supports or seeks to appeal to the interests of ordinary people.
meanings.sent1: The politician claimed to be a populist, always speaking up for the common folk.
meanings.sent2: The populist leader gained a large following by championing the concerns of everyday citizens.
meanings.sent3: The birthday party clown decided to take a populist approach, making balloon animals for all the kids.
meanings.sent4: Her storytelling style was so populist that it felt like the characters were real people you knew.
meanings.sent5: In the play, the protagonist was portrayed as a populist hero fighting for justice.

meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of populism.
meanings.sent1: The candidate's populist message resonated with many voters.
meanings.sent2: The populist movement aimed to address the concerns of the working class.
meanings.sent3: The restaurant's menu had a populist appeal, offering simple and affordable dishes.
meanings.sent4: Her fashion sense was described as populist, focusing on comfortable and practical clothing.
meanings.sent5: The artist's work had a populist quality, accessible and relatable to all audiences.

meanings.definition: A member or adherent of a political party seeking to represent the interests of ordinary people.
meanings.sent1: The group of populists gathered to discuss their strategies for the upcoming election.
meanings.sent2: The populist party promised to prioritize the needs of the working class.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, he dressed up as a populist politician, complete with a campaign button.
meanings.sent4: The team captain was a true populist, always advocating for the fair treatment of all players.
meanings.sent5: In the historical novel, the protagonist joined forces with a group of populists to fight for equality.
